Class Variable

  • java.lang.Object
    • Variable

  • public class Variable
extends java.lang.Object
    The Variable class is contains all the functions and variables needed for the variables for the distributed database, including the locks. The lockList in it lists of all the locks currently placed on this (copy of); the waitList in it lists of all the locks which will be placed on this (copy of) variable, currently are waiting for other locks to release.
    Author:
    Wenzhao Zang, Dongbo Xiao

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      (package private) java.util.List<Lock> lockList 
      (package private) java.lang.String name 
      (package private) int value 
      (package private) java.util.List<Lock> waitList 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Variable(java.lang.String name, int value) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canWait(Transaction t)
      check if a transaction can wait for efficiency, there is no need to add a lock to the wait list if there exists an older transaction, so the time stamps of the transactions in the wait list should be in strict decreasing order
      void changeReadReady(boolean isReadyForRead)
      when a site recovers, mark it false for all replicated variables and mark it true for all non-replicated variables, when a write is done, mark it true
      void changeValue(int value)
      change the value when a write operation is performed
      void cleanLock()
      clean lock when a transaction ends or a site fails, the lock release process will be triggered from the corresponding objects, so a lock which has been released will be marked as inactive but still exist in the variable lock list, such locks should be removed whenever the variable object is visited
      void cleanWait()
      clean wait if a lock is in the wait list and is never acquired because the transaction aborts or the site fails, it should be removed from the wait list
      java.util.List<Lock> getLockList()
      lockList getter
      java.lang.String getName()
      variable name getter
      int getValue()
      variable value getter
      Lock getWriteLock()
      if a variable has write lock, return that write lock
      boolean hasLock()
      hasLock
      boolean hasWriteLock()
      if the variable has write lock when a transaction wants to read, it needs to examine if there is write lock on this variable before examination, make sure all the locks in the lock list are active (remove the locks which have been released due to the end of a transaction or the failure of a site)
      boolean isReadyForRead()
      is ready for read
      void placeLock(Lock lock)
      place a lock on the variable
      void update()
      update whenever a lock on this variable is released, update the lock list and check if locks in the wait list also should be moved to the active lock list
      void wait(Lock lock)
      add a lock in the waitList

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • hasWriteLock

        public boolean hasWriteLock()
        if the variable has write lock when a transaction wants to read, it needs to examine if there is write lock on this variable before examination, make sure all the locks in the lock list are active (remove the locks which have been released due to the end of a transaction or the failure of a site)
        Returns:
        boolean if the variable has write lock

      • getWriteLock

        public Lock getWriteLock()
        if a variable has write lock, return that write lock
        Returns:
        the write lock if the variable does have one

      • hasLock

        public boolean hasLock()
        hasLock
        Returns:
        boolean if has lock

      • cleanLock

        public void cleanLock()
        clean lock when a transaction ends or a site fails, the lock release process will be triggered from the corresponding objects, so a lock which has been released will be marked as inactive but still exist in the variable lock list, such locks should be removed whenever the variable object is visited

      • cleanWait

        public void cleanWait()
        clean wait if a lock is in the wait list and is never acquired because the transaction aborts or the site fails, it should be removed from the wait list
